data.title: kashmiri men: Latest News & Videos, Photos about kashmiri men
data.meta_description: kashmiri men Latest Breaking News, Pictures, Videos, and Special Reports from The Economic Times. kashmiri men  Blogs, Comments and Archive News on Economictimes.com
data.text:
Go To Page 1

Kashmiri Pandit employees reiterate demand for relocation outside Valley

Hundreds of employees, both men and women, assembled under the banner of 'All Migrant Employee Association Kashmir' outside the Press Club carrying placards, some of which read, "Don't rehabilitate us at the cost of our blood! Orphaning our children! Widowing our wives! and the only solution is relocation anywhere outside Valley."

13 Jun, 2022, 04:15 PM IST

View: Why Kashmiri Pandits should be investing in life beyond Kashmir

What does reassessing their lives and future mean for Kashmiri Pandits? It begins by accepting that they have no future whatsoever in Kashmir. Not tomorrow, or day after. Not in five years, not in ten. This has to be understood separately from the security scenario.

05 Jun, 2022, 10:44 AM IST

Kashmiri youths travelling to Pakistan on valid visas sneak back in with terrorists; 17 killed so far

Recently, the University Grants Commission and the All Indian Council for Technical Education, the higher and technical education regulators of the country, had issued a statement, advising students not to travel to Pakistan for pursuing higher education.

01 May, 2022, 04:45 PM IST

J&K: CRPF soldier killed; Kashmiri Pandit, 2 Bihar labourers injured in militant attacks

CRPF personnel were attacked on Monday afternoon near the busy Maisuma area of Srinagar, where they were stationed as part of the daily security routine. Police officials said two CRPF men were injured when unidentified attackers fired at them. They were shifted to a hospital, but one of them succumbed to the injuries. The police and paramilitary launched an immediate search operation in the area to nab the attackers. The political parties in Kashmir condemned that attack on the CRPF personnel.

05 Apr, 2022, 12:29 AM IST

Many Kashmiri youths visiting Pakistan on valid papers infiltrating back as terrorists: Officials

Security agencies made a quick estimate of passports issued between 2015 and 2019, and found that out of the 40 youths who had gone to Bangladesh or Pakistan for studies, 28 had infiltrated back into the country as trained terrorists, officials said.

01 Aug, 2021, 05:27 PM IST

3 things nailed Pulwama mastermind: Adidas jacket, Kashmiri lover and a damaged mobile

Intelligence agencies had no clue that the mastermind of the attack, Masood Azhar’s nephew Umar Farooq, had crossed over into Kashmir or that he had been killed in an encounter just a month after Pulwama. So what led the NIA joining the dots? It was Umar Farooq’s love for sportswear and a Kashmiri woman.

20 Jun, 2021, 10:13 AM IST

Around 100 Kashmiri youth who visited Pakistan on visa in last three years are missing

The security establishment has found that in the last three years around 100 youth from Kashmir who travelled to Pakistan on a visa are missing. "They have either never returned or have returned but are missing," said an IPS officer adding that they can be part of 'sleeper cells' of terror organisations.

08 Feb, 2021, 04:14 PM IST

Alarm raised after some Kashmiri youths travelling to Pakistan on visa infiltrate with terrorists

Alarm bells rang in April last year when a group of five terrorists were killed in jungles of the border area of Handwara in North Kashmir. One of them was a local who went to Pakistan in 2018 and had not returned since, various officials from security agencies said.

07 Feb, 2021, 02:22 PM IST

The Indian Army officer and his five men who saved three journalists and fell to LeT bullets

Twenty-one years to the day, as the Army paid tribute to its six men on Tuesday, there were many who doffed their hat to the bravery of the quick thinking officer - the Public Relations Officer (Defence) saved the lives of three Kashmiri journalists who had come to meet him that fateful evening.

03 Nov, 2020, 05:02 PM IST

NIA files charge-sheet against 3 men trained in Pakistan to carry out attacks in India

The charge-sheet against Muneeb Hameed Bhat, Junaid Ahmad Mattoo and Umer Rashid Wani, all residents of Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district, was filed before a special NIA court in Jammu on Thursday. It was filed under sections of the Ranbir Penal Code and the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act.

02 Oct, 2020, 05:32 PM IST

His daughter’s father, ‘Col Courage’ melted for his men and his family

Colonel Ashutosh Sharma, commanding officer (CO) of 21 Rashtriya Rifles who lost his life while fighting terrorists at Changimulla in Handwara tehsil of Kupwara in north Kashmir, had “scalped” – as some soldiers would say -- an enviable number of the enemy’s head. It was 30 at last count.

04 May, 2020, 11:18 AM IST

Pakistani handlers told terrorists in Kashmir they will get bangles if they don't cause unrest: NSA

Doval told a select group of journalists that there are Pakistani communications towers along a 20-km stretch of the border from where they are sending messages to terrorists.

07 Sep, 2019, 10:12 PM IST

NSA Doval says totally convinced most Kashmiris support abrogation of 370

"I am fully convinced that a majority of Kashmirs totally support the abrogation of Article 370," Doval said.

07 Sep, 2019, 02:02 PM IST

Why shouldn’t men also chase glamour and sumptuousness, asks veteran designer Manish Malhotra

Jewel tones, textured fabrics and relaxed fits are some trends Malhotra anticipates for the upcoming season.

23 Aug, 2019, 10:50 AM IST

Haryana CM Khattar draws flak for remarks on Kashmiri women, says it is 'distorted news'

"Now people say that since Kashmir is open, we can bring girls from there. Jokes apart, if there is a good (sex) ratio, the balance in the society will be set right," Khattar said.

10 Aug, 2019, 05:26 PM IST

View: The real cost of scrapping Article 370 is majoritarian gains in India’s polity, not erosion of Kashmiriyat

Since it is extremely dangerous to speak against the separatist militants, protests against the security forces have been more open and vocal.

05 Aug, 2019, 06:34 PM IST

Grant citizenship or deport, demand Pakistani wives of former Kashmiri militants

Pakistani wives of Kashmiri ex-militants have appealed the Centre and state government to either grant them passport or deport them.

12 Jul, 2019, 03:32 PM IST

Attacks on Kashmiris will do more harm to idea of India in J&K than anything else: Omar Abdullah

The former chief minister was reacting to a video in which two Kashmiris were being seen thrashed by a group of men in Lucknow.

07 Mar, 2019, 01:37 PM IST

Pintu Kumar Singh: The officer who played guide to Kashmiri youth dies fighting terrorists

The news of Singh’s death came as the Central Reserve Police Force was trying to come to terms with the loss of its 40 soldiers in the Pulwama terror attack.

04 Mar, 2019, 08:14 AM IST

CRPF takes Kashmiri teens to Kolkata on a 3-day Bharat darshan

The CRPF thanked the parents who agreed to send their children to the outreach programme four days after the Pulwama incident.

22 Feb, 2019, 08:00 AM IST

View: War with Pakistan not an option for India, focus on Kashmiris

Pakistan is not our problem. We must ignore Pakistan for the next 10-15 years.

17 Feb, 2019, 09:00 AM IST

View: Focus on stopping the radicalisation & alienation of Kashmiri youths

The indoctrination and radicalisation of South Kashmir is frightening.

17 Feb, 2019, 08:56 AM IST

Kashmiri women who choose to click amidst chaos

A common refrain among these young women, who seek to challenge the patriarchy, is the need for supportive parents.

23 Sep, 2018, 03:01 PM IST
